conclusion: Consider principles of physics, specifically conservation of momentum and effects of collisions.
Car A is located on the left side of the image.
Car B is located on the right side of the image.
Both cars are moving towards each other.
Initial velocities of both cars can be assumed to be equal in magnitude but opposite in direction.
Total momentum before collision equals total momentum after collision.
Cars are identical in mass and moving towards each other with the same speed.
Collision will result in an elastic collision if no external force acts on them.
Total momentum before collision is zero because their momenta cancel each other out.
Total momentum after collision must still be zero.
In elastic collision between two objects of equal mass moving towards each other, final velocities will be equal in magnitude but opposite in direction.
Car A will move in the direction it was originally moving after collision.
Car B will move in the direction it was originally moving after collision.
Final positions of cars will be symmetric about the point of collision.
Car A will stop at the position it was initially at.
Car B will stop at the position it was initially at.
Final positions of cars A and B will be the same as their initial positions.
Final Answer: Car A and Car B will stop at their initial positions.
